reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars If something seems too good to be true...
reviews.reviewText: I love, love, love this author! Then again, what’s not to love about a fellow New Englander who writes great thrillers. I love his writing style and the way he always includes gourmet food and cool alcoholic beverages in his books. I was hungry by the time I finished this! LolThis is an engaging account of a young bride who marries a very wealthy entrepreneur. Abigail convinces herself that the marriage is right for her, but admits that Bruce’s money is appealing. During her bachelorette weekend, she has too much to drink and is seduced by a handsome stranger. Unable to tell Bruce what she’s done, she proceeds to marry him and go on their honeymoon to a remote island in Maine. Shortly after she arrives at the island, she discovers that the man she had a one night stand with is also there. She starts to notice other strange coincidences and occurrences, but even when she tells her husband she’s creeped out, he is not agreeable to leaving. From there, a nightmare begins to unfold...This was slightly predictable at times, but moved along at a nice pace. The circumstances were a little far fetched, but I didn’t mind this. The ending was action packed! I would have included a little more on the outcome, but it was satisfying enough.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book was entertaining to me. I felt like it was super predictable, though. I had it figured out before 50% book. However, I still read it and enjoyed it. I loved that Abigail is strong and not willing to back down. If you like adventure campy thrillers then this would be perfect!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars 3.5 Stars Interesting Tale of survival
reviews.reviewText: This book was interesting. The beginning peaked my interest enough that I continued with the story. Abigail is probably the 1st FMC That I found myself neither rooting for nor hoping she'd win, I just genuinely wanted to see how it would all play out. The first half of the book was a slow build that I didn't mind. The mystery doesn't really start to unfold until the 50% and once things started rolling my this book had my attention. I saw a few of the plot twists i saw coming but they still got even though I knew there were about to hit. The ending was a bit of a bore but overall I didn't mind the read, it was engaging enough that I wanted to finish it but it wasn't a book I was in a rush to finish. 3.5 stars. I purchased Peter Swanson's Eight Perfect Murders, I still plan on reading it and based on that book I may read other books from him or scratch him off the list.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Every Vow You Break by Peter Swanson
reviews.reviewText: For better or for worse...Abigail is getting ready to marry her millionaire fiancé, Bruce, when she has a drunken one-night stand during her bachelorette weekend getaway. After a moment of doubt, she decides to push the incident, and handsome man, out of her mind for good. Trying to focus on her marriage and future with her newlywed husband, Abigail spots the mysterious man from her girl's weekend. He's insistent that they have something special. How did he follow her to this luxurious and remote island? And why do strange things keep happening on there?This was another interesting read by Peter Swanson. I really enjoyed this book! I was gifted a physical copy of it by my bookstore manager and checked out a bit of the audiobook; The narrator was great! I flew through this book, looking forward to finding out answers to all my questions. Many of my predictions were correct, however there were a few that caught me off guard! If you're a psychological thriller fan, check this one out!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I thought that the Stalker was only a twist. I did figure out the what was occurring on Island but I wasn't prepared to or the twists. This author has an unique gift to write a story in real time and have the reader step in the shoes of his characters. I was cold on the island before the author described the environment. I thought the main character's reaction was believable and that's the author did not change his story to suit the reader.Keep the excellent stories coming.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Quick paced and really liked it!
reviews.reviewText: 4 ⭐⭐⭐⭐ for Every Vow You Break by Peter Swanson. It would have gotten 5 stars but the beginning was a bit slow but it certainly rectifies that about halfway in. Takes place in Massachusetts, New York, and Maine. The main character Abigail is engaged to be married to Bruce. At her Bachelorette weekend she has too much to drink and has a one night stand that she decides not to tell her fiance about. The wedding goes as planned with the "incident" kept a secret apart from her best friend Zoe knowing about it, or so we are led to believe. The honeymoon on Heart Pond Island off the coast of Maine (which there really is an island/pond called that in Maine FYI) once there honeymooning the sh*t hits the fan. From this point on this mystery quickly intensifies and presents non stop action and drama. I really liked it, I am glad I didn't fold during the "almost too much information" at the beginning. The beginning chapters, especially the ones about her previous relationships just held no foundation to the overall story except for the reader to know a lot more about Abigail. Regardless, quick read and kept my interest.
Mientras menos sepan de la trama, mejor. Muchos giros y lo leí rapidísimo. Super recomendado!
